allowAddParticipants.description: Enables the feature to add participants from √çris. Note: This command is disabled by default for safety reasons due to the elevated risk of receiving a WhatsApp ban.

allowEvents.description: Enable detection of events, like promoting, demoting or gaming events like MMM (Minecraft Mining Mode).

allowGPT.description: Activate the LLM (Large Language Model) for GPT-like functionality. This feature is CPU intensive and is best suited for systems with CUDA GPUs. Avoid using it on slow systems. Ensure your machine has a powerful CPU or is equipped with CUDA technology.

answerMode.description: Define how Iris should respond to prompts.
answerMode.value: short, very friendly, and laid-back way

botAge.description: If √çris's age is set to 0, it will reflect her real age.

botCommands.description: Specifies whether √çris should execute commands from her messages. Note: This feature may have serious bugs and is not 100% tested.

botGender.description: Defines the role of √çris. It can be any recognized gender or role.

botSexuality.description: Define √çris's sexuality. You can include any sexuality or combination of sexualities that fits her gender, age, and personality.

botPersonality.description: Defines the personality of √çris. It can include any personality traits, such as: angry, cute, patient, caring, intelligent or more.
botPersonality.value: charming, charismatic, intelligent, helpful, caring, patient, and adorable

botName.description: Defines the name of the BOT.

chatName.description: Specifies the AI model used for conversations. Possible values are: gpt4all, transformers

codeReload.description: Enables automatic code reloading, eliminating the need for restarts, can cause bugs.

colorSet.description: Defines the color palettes used to print messages and commands to the terminal. Set in the following order: [Normal Text, Body Preview, Date, Groups and Numbers, Command]. Use English named colors and avoid complexity.

commandsCooldown.description: Sets the cooldown in milliseconds for command usage. It should be synchronized with 'maxCommands' for effective anti-spam control or use default values.

consoleType.description: Defines what information is logged on the screen. A value of 1 prints all information, 2 for messages only, and 3 for commands only.

fixEscape.description: Enable this if you encounter errors with commas or symbols in SQLite. Note that this will remove, not escape, special characters. In anycase, still very useful with √çris database errors.

fullError.description: The error log method. When set to 'true,' it prints all information, making it ideal for bug reporting. Alternatively, setting it to 'false' is suitable for experts and those who prefer concise and stylish error messages.

gptModel.description: Specifies the model to use; see available models at https://huggingface.co/models?library=transformers.js (for Transfomers mode) and https://docs.gpt4all.io/gpt4all_python/home.html (for GPT4All mode); examples: rocket-3b.Q4_0.gguf, Xenova/blenderbot_small-90M

gptTokens.description: Defines the maximum context window size for sessions. Lower values provide faster responses. Set 0 to automatic calculation.

gptPromptTemplate.description: Define the USER model template for GPT. Different models use different templates, but the placeholders %1 and %2 are consistent across all models. For specific details, please refer to the model‚Äôs webpage on Hugging Face or GPT4All.

gptSystemPrompt.description: Define the SYSTEM model template for GPT. Different models use different templates. Please refer to the model's webpage on Hugging Face for specific details.

gptTemperature.description: Defines the creativity of the model's responses. Higher values generate more varied and random answers, while lower values produce more conservative and similar responses. Setting the value to zero will make the model respond in the same way every time. Typically, a value between 0 and 1 is used.

gptWindowSize.description: Define the maximum number of NGL tokens (context window) for GPT4All. The default is 2048.

ignoreSecurityChecks.description: When activated, √çris executes tasks without waiting for codes to finish (synchronous execution), potentially leading to security vulnerabilities, lags, and bugs, but it enhances command speed.

language.description: Sets the general language for the system and unconfigured users.

listenBroadcasts.description: Specifies if √çris should not ignore people sending status or broadcasts (Yes, √çris sees everything).

listenPolls.description: Specifies if √çris should not ignore poll updates, like votes. If enabled, it will treat poll updates as messages.

listenReactions.description: Specifies if √çris should not ignore reactions. If enabled, it will treat reactions as messages.

maxCommands.description: Sets the maximum number of commands a user can run without triggering the anti-spam feature (cooldown is controlled by 'commandsCooldown').

maxDecryptSize.description: Sets the maximum size of √çris decrypt system in kilobytes. Higher values can freeze code when decrypting large files or temporarily increase RAM usage significantly.

mediaCooldown.description: Sets the cooldown in milliseconds for media messages. It should be synchronized with 'maxCommands' for effective anti-spam control or use default values.

minSimilarity.description: Fixes wrong commands based on the similarity between the wrong and the available commands.

owner.description: An array of users authorized to run any command.

pairingCode.description: Defines if the connection should use pairing code instead of qrcode, minified to help termux edition by sed.

prefixes.description: Defines the prefixes recognized as commands. Does not affect noprefix commands.

reactOnWork.description: Defines if √çris will react on messages when doing some commands, request waiting or when receiving some error at execution of the message, DO NOT ABUSE.

readOldMessages.description: This indicates if √çris should read loading messages when coming back online. This can slow down overall performance and may cause errors in media messages, but it is helpful for tasks like ranking and leveling.

secureGroup.description: Specifies a secure group for receiving logs in case of system failures to send messages to the correct person or chat. Set 'false' to disable.

secretKey.description: Sets the password used to bypass owner and admin requirements. Never use the default. Create a VERY STRONG password, as this can be SUPER HYPER EXTREMELY DANGEROUS.

sendSER.description: Set how error messages will be sent. If set to 'false', it will only say an error occurred. If set to 'true', very detailed error messages will be sent on WhatsApp. Use these messages to contact the DEV community. | Careful, because: No log = No support.

spammerTime.description: Sets the time in milliseconds to block any commands sent by someone spamming. For example, if set to 300000, the spammer will need to wait 5 minutes to run commands again.

stickerAuthor.description: Sets the author of the created stickers. Keep as default to generate automatic names based on group and user names. Keep the default (optional) to support official devs XD.

stickerColors.description: The amount of colors to use into ATTP, more you set, more slow will be.

stickerFPS.description: The FPS rate of ATTP stickers, more fps is equal to more faster color will change.

stickerPack.description: Specifies the pack of stickers. Keep the default to create stickers based on information.

stickerQuality.description: Sets the default quality of stickers. Use values from 0 to 100. Higher values may result in stickers being unable to send or becoming extremely heavy, increasing the risk of a ban. If unsure, keep the default.

tagAdmins.description: Determines whether √çris should tag administrators when she detects and sends spam alerts in a group.

taskerEval.description: Defines if should eval codes sent from apps like tasker, macrodroid or raw bash script, careful, this setting is DANGEROUS, do not enable if you have set a weak secretKey and yourName.

useBanner.description: This controls if √çris should use a banner inside the menu or just send the text, the default banner as made by JoJo.

waitMessage.description: If enabled, √çris will send a message requesting the user to wait for the command to finish to avoid lags.

warnLimit.description: Set the limit of warnings send by warn.

yourName.description: Specifies the owner's name, required for tasker execution.
